Description: Lower body sherd of Chian, possibly Wild Goat Style, pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed (fired reddish) with two added white bands; exterior: trace of single brown band above a possible rising ray; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: Rising rays are found on the lower body of Chian Wild Goat Style chalices but they disappear from the repertoire in circa 600BC.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0085) (phase 2)
